documentation_candidates.limitation_statement: The Bayzat platform currently does not support indefinite carry-over of unused air ticket balances. Users cannot automatically transfer unused ticket allowances between policy years, which limits flexibility in time-off management.
documentation_candidates.user_impact: Customers must manually calculate total requests for multi-year policies (e.g., 5 requests/year × 5 years = 25 total requests). Unused balances do not carry forward between policy years, requiring careful upfront planning.
documentation_candidates.workaround: For multi-year policies requiring X requests per year over Y years, set total number of requests to X × Y. For example, 5 requests annually over 5 years requires setting total requests to 25.
documentation_candidates.guide_section: Air Ticket Policy Configuration — Multi-Year Cycles and Request Allocation

documentation_candidates.summary: Air tickets - Booked tickets notification (tagging LM when not in approval flow OR workflow on ticket requests)
documentation_candidates.limitation_statement: The Bayzat platform currently cannot notify or tag line managers about ticket processing when they are outside the standard approval flow. There is no automated notification system for proxy requesters or managers raising requests for employees.
documentation_candidates.user_impact: Line managers who submit air ticket requests on behalf of blue collar employees cannot receive notifications when tickets are processed. They must manually check system status or rely on email communication, creating visibility gaps.
documentation_candidates.workaround: Ensure line managers are included in the air ticket approval workflow to receive notifications. Alternatively, use email communication as a workaround for status updates.
documentation_candidates.guide_section: Air Ticket Request Notifications — Tracking Status for Proxy Requesters

documentation_candidates.summary: As an employee I want to manage my air ticket requests from my air tickets
documentation_candidates.limitation_statement: The platform currently lacks a unified interface for employees to manage air ticket requests under various policy conditions. There are specific scenarios where employees cannot fully interact with or understand their air ticket encashment status.
documentation_candidates.user_impact: Employees cannot manage air ticket requests when auto-encashment policy is inactive, hire date/probation end date is missing, or they are not yet eligible. This creates confusion about policy status and eligibility requirements.
documentation_candidates.workaround: Ensure employee records are complete (hire date, probation end date) before assigning auto-encashment policies. Verify policy is active and employee meets eligibility criteria before attempting to manage air ticket requests.
documentation_candidates.guide_section: Air Ticket Auto-Encashment — Policy Requirements and Eligibility

documentation_candidates.limitation_statement: The current Expense Manager role lacks granular permission controls to limit data visibility. The platform does not provide configurable options to restrict cross-module access or segment viewable financial information by category.
documentation_candidates.user_impact: Expense Managers can view all employee loans and air tickets, not just work expenses. Organizations cannot restrict sensitive financial data access by role, creating potential privacy and security concerns.
documentation_candidates.workaround: Currently no workaround available. Organizations must accept that Expense Manager role has broad visibility across financial modules or use alternative role assignments.
documentation_candidates.guide_section: Role-Based Access Control — Expense Manager Permissions and Data Visibility

documentation_candidates.summary: Letter requests - upload the document after stamping
documentation_candidates.limitation_statement: The current Bayzat platform does not support a flexible document approval workflow that allows post-approval modifications, attachment uploads, or status reversions for letter requests.
documentation_candidates.user_impact: Users cannot download letter requests, stamp them externally, and re-upload signed documents. Approved requests cannot be modified or have attachments added, and approved requests cannot be returned to pending status for document updates.
documentation_candidates.workaround: Ensure all documents are properly signed and stamped before approving letter requests. Use email to share final signed documents with employees rather than uploading through the system.
documentation_candidates.guide_section: Letter Request Workflow — External Stamping and Document Upload Limitations

documentation_candidates.summary: Restricted People manager role - can still see other employees (out of assigned group)
documentation_candidates.limitation_statement: The Bayzat platform currently lacks full role-based group restrictions, with grouping functionality limited to finance and payroll modules. People Manager and Adjustment Manager roles can view and edit employees outside their assigned groups across HR and document modules.
documentation_candidates.user_impact: Employee group restrictions only apply to Air Tickets and finance/payroll modules. People Managers and Adjustment Managers can view and edit employees outside their assigned groups in HR modules, Documents, and Departments, limiting organizational control.
documentation_candidates.workaround: Be aware that employee grouping restrictions are limited to finance and payroll modules. For HR module access control, use alternative permission strategies or accept that role-based grouping does not restrict HR module visibility.
documentation_candidates.guide_section: Employee Groups and Role Restrictions — Module-Specific Limitations

excluded.summary: Limited access for employees to view other users
excluded.reason: Ticket is about a planned feature (Employee Grouping and Structures) already on roadmap for HR modules. While it documents a feature gap, it is a strategic product decision with no current UI to test and no immediate user documentation value since feature is not yet available. Should be revisited when feature ships.

excluded.summary: Need to delete the test air tickets processed
excluded.reason: Ticket documents that processed air tickets cannot be deleted through any UI mechanism - this is a backend system limitation with no testable UI elements. While it reveals a feature gap, the limitation is clear and obvious to users (no delete button exists), requiring no additional documentation.
